content: Claude Opus 4.6 and GPT-5.3 Codex, released within 18 minutes of each other, represent fundamentally different engineering philosophies: autonomous agents versus interactive collaboration.
To properly use Opus 4.6, users must update Claude Code to version 2.1.32+, set the model in settings.json, and explicitly enable the experimental Agent Teams feature.
Opus 4.6's standout feature is multi-agent orchestration, allowing users to spin up parallel agents for research, architecture, UX, and testing to work simultaneously.
GPT-5.3 Codex's standout feature is mid-task steering, enabling users to interrupt, redirect, and course-correct the model while it is actively building.

In a live head-to-head, Codex finished a Polymarket competitor in under 4 minutes, while Opus took significantly longer but produced a more polished UI, richer feature set, and 96 tests compared to Codex's 10.
Agent teams in Opus 4.6 substantially multiply token usage, with a single build potentially consuming 150,000â€“250,000 tokens across all agents.

Developers using Opus 4.6 need to update via NPM, verify version 2.1.32+, set the model to Opus in settings.json, and enable the experimental Agent Teams flag by setting `claude_code_experimental_agent_teams` to one.
Opus 4.6 offers a 1-million-token context window, strong architectural comprehension, and less tendency to write reckless code.
GPT-5.3 Codex has a roughly 200,000-token context window, excels on SWE-Bench Pro and coding benchmarks, and is strong in progressive execution and rapid iteration.
Claude (Opus 4.6) is like a senior staff engineer asking 'should we do this?', while GPT-5.3 (Codex) is like a founding engineer asking 'how fast can I ship this?'.

When designing prompts for Opus 4.6, instruct it to build an agent team with specialists (e.g., architecture, prediction market domain, UX, testing). For Codex, give a parallel prompt asking it to think deeply about the same areas.
Opus 4.6 excels when delegating whole chunks of work to autonomous agents for comprehensive results review.
Codex 5.3 excels as a fast, interactive collaborator that can be steered in real time.
